body_html:
That's right. Furthermore, If you want to keep state between two calls to dynamic_rnn, you'd have to take the final state from the first call and pass it in as the initial state in the second call. This of very rarely done in practice.
…

I've take a quick glimpse at the rnn_ops.py, it seems the dynamic_rnn call will auto clear the cells' state unless I wanna keep them isn't? body:
That's right. Furthermore, If you want to keep state between two calls to
dynamic_rnn, you'd have to take the final state from the first call and
pass it in as the initial state in the second call. This of very rarely
done in practice.

On May 9, 2017 11:24 PM, "ruiann" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @ebrevdo <https://github.com/ebrevdo>
> Thx for your answer. I've take a quick glimpse at the rnn_ops.py, it seems
> the dynamic_rnn call will auto clear the cells' state unless I wanna keep
> them isn't? So I can just set the reuse as True in the second call thus the
> code can run as I want regardless of the TF version?
>
> —
